phrasetype.name: Activity Stream
phrasetype.phrase: {1} commented on blog entry {3} in {5}
{2} commented on blog entry {4} in {6}
{2} created a blog entry {4} in {6}

phrasetype.name: Control Panel Global
phrasetype.phrase: Remove this amount per month since the last comment (0-1.00)
Remove this amount per month since blog post date (0 - 1.00)

This page allows you to control the priority setting in your XML sitemap based on blog popularity and age. The priority will be calculated for each blog post based on the values you put here. Note no matter what values you use the calculated priority will never be more than one or less than zero.

phrasetype.name: Control Panel Help Text
phrasetype.phrase: This permission controls soft deletion for blog comments, enabling this will provide the option to simply hide the comments from view to non moderators.
This permission controls soft deletion for blog entries, enabling this will provide the option to simply hide the entries from view to non moderators.
This permission controls removal of blog entries, if this permission is granted entries can be removed permanently from the database.

This page contains several counters that you can update.

Rebuild Blog Entry Information:
This feature will rebuild the total comments, trackbacks and last post information for each blog entry.

Rebuild Blog User Information:
This will rebuild the total entry count for categories as well as the total entries, comments, trackbacks and last post information for each blog.

Rebuild Blog Counters:
This will rebuild the total entry count for categories, total attachments and trackbacks for a blog entry.

Clear Parsed Text Cache:
This will clear all the current cached text entries, this may be useful if you have added or changed permissions on a bbcode or other settings affecting post output.

Rebuild Attachment Thumbnails:
Rebuilding thumbnails is necessary after changing your thumbnail settings in your vBulletin options.
This permission controls removal of blog comments, if this permission is granted comments can be removed permanently from the database.

When disabled, bbcode is stripped, links are replaced with the [link] placeholder and attachments are not displayed.

Enabling full parsing of bbcode and attachments displays the featured entry as it does when opened. When using a fixed width style, the parsing of bbcode and attachment may stretch the entry so that it flows out of the style.
The blogid of the specific entry that is to be featured. The blogid can be found in the url of the entry following b=.
The order of multiple featured entries is handled by this setting. A choice of 1 will display first.
Limit entry selection to those posted before a specific date.
Limit the entry to that posted by a user of a specific usergroup.
Random entries are cached for a set period of time to increase performance. This is the minimum amount of time that will pass between the selection of a new random entry.
Limit the entry selection those posted after a specific date.
Limit the entry to that of a user who belongs to a specific secondary usergroup.
The selection of random entries can be limited to a specific span of time. For example, "Past 24 Hours" would only include entries that were posted in the past 24 hours.

Random Entry: This is a random entry, chosen by a set of criteria defined by the administrator.

Specific Entry: This is a specific entry.

Latest Entry: This is the newest entry that the viewing user can access.

Only entries that are visible by guests will be displayed for random and latest entries.
Limit the entry that posted by a specific user.

Select an end date for this report. Select a month, day, and year. The selected statistic must not be newer than this date for it to be included in the report. You can use this setting in conjunction with the "Start Date" setting to create a window of time for this report.
Any days, weeks, or months that have no results will not be shown if this option is set to "No".
Select the unit of time by which you want the report to group the statistics. If you select "Daily" then the report will tell you the number per day, etc.
"Ascending" order will put the oldest dates at the top of the report and the newest dates at the bottom... the dates "ascend" as you get further into the report. "Descending" is just the opposite.
Select a start date for this report. Select a month, day, and year. The selected statistic must be no older than this date for it to be included in the report.
The type of statistic that will be returned. "Visitors": Registered User Activity, "Entries": New Entries Posted, "Comments": New Comments Posted.
Limit the statistics to those generated by a single blog.

Thread tagging is a system that allows user to apply their own keywords (tags) to threads. See Wikipedia for more information on the ideas behind tagging.

This area allows you to manage the existing tags and create new ones. Note that you cannot create tags that your normal users would not be able to use. This means that you can't violate the length options or used censored words.

This setting controls the number of comments that display per page on blog entries.

Note: This number must be at least 1.
Set this to the maximum number of videos you wish to allow per custom block. Set this to 0 to disable the videos count.
Set this to the maximum number of videos you wish to allow per blog comment. Set this to 0 to disable the videos count.

If set to 'Yes', all comments are placed into a moderation queue for approval by board staff before being visible to site visitors.

It may be a legal requirement to enable this option in some cases, such as for boards run in Germany.

If you would like to have all comments from only certain usergroups sent to the moderation queue, the usergroup editor provides this ability. This ability can also be set by a blog owner for each entry.
Set this to the maximum number of images you wish to allow per blog entry. Set this to 0 to disable the images count.
Set this to the maximum number of videos you wish to allow per blog entry. Set this to 0 to disable the videos count.

This is the maximum number of entries per page on blog lists.

Note: This number must be at least 1.
Maximum Displayed Entries Before Page Split
The maximum total tags per entry. No users may add more tags than this to an individual entry. 0 disables this.

The maximum number of tags the entry author can apply. Even if this setting allows it, the number of tags in an entry cannot exceed the "Maximum Tags per Entry" setting. 0 disables this limit. To prevent a user from tagging an entry, use user group permissions.
Maximum Tags Applied by Entry Author

The maximum number of tags the users other than the entry author can apply. Even if this setting allows it, the number of tags in an entry cannot exceed the "Maximum Tags per Entry" setting. 0 disables this limit. To prevent a user from tagging an entry, use user group permissions.
Maximum Tags Applied by Other Users
Set this to the maximum number of videos you wish to allow per custom page. Set this to 0 to disable the videos count.

This is the default number of entries per page on blog lists.

Note: This number must be at least 1.

If set to 'Yes', all entries are placed into a moderation queue for approval by board staff before being visible to site visitors.

It may be a legal requirement to enable this option in some cases, such as for boards run in Germany.

If you would like to have all entries from only certain usergroups sent to the moderation queue, the usergroup editor provides this ability.

Enter a positive integer number.

Entry ratings are relatively inaccurate with just a few votes. This setting can be used to delay the results until enough votes have been cast to give a more accurate rating.
You can specify a style that will apply only to blog pages, this will allow the blogs to have a different style to that of the main forum.
Time, in minutes, to keep the tag cloud data cached for. A value of 0 will disable the caching.

In order to prevent tags in private blogs for modifying the data in the tag cloud, you may force the tag cloud to be built only from blogs that are visible to all users. Tags will be only be counted for blogs where that user can view entries.

Choosing 'Permission Check' will prevent the tag cloud from being cached, but it will respect the permissions of the browsing user.

'No Permission Check' will skip the permission checking entirely. This effectively ignores that private status of a blog.

This is the number of sizes that tags are displayed in.

If you wish to increase this value above 5, you will need to edit the blog.css template and add additional CSS rules for the additional levels.

If you enable this option, a new tag cloud will be shown at the bottom of the advanced search page. This tag cloud differs from the version here because it is based on the amount of searches done for a particular tag instead of the number of times the tag is used.

The number of days that tag searching information should be stored for. This information is used to build the tag cloud.

0 will keep data around permanently.
The maximum number of tags that will be displayed in the tag cloud. A higher number provides more information to a user but may appear to be more cluttered.

This option controls the number of days worth of data that will be used to create the usage-based tag cloud shown here. Any tags added outside this range will not be taken into account for the tag cloud.

The tag cloud can serve as a list of what's popular on your blog. You can use this option to prevent what was popular earlier from skewing against what's popular now.
If you enable this option, "A" through "Z" will be replaced with "a" through "z" in tag names. Other characters will not be changed.
Force Tags to be Lower Case

Blog tagging is a system that allows user to apply their own keywords (tags) to threads. See Wikipedia for more information on the ideas behind tagging.

This option is a global switch. If you choose no, tagging will be disabled globally. Existing tag information will not be displayed. If you choose yes, you may choose who can tag entries in the usergroup permissions section.

This is the maximum number of bytes in a tag name. In most situations, this also corresponds to the number of characters.

A tag name may contain any character except a comma. Tags with censored words are not allowed.
The minimum number of characters in a tag name. This can be between 1 and 100.

This feature requires that the "Always use Forum URL as Base Path" be set to yes.

This will override the main Forum URL setting for blog pages to allow the blog pages to be accessed from a different directory than the rest of vBulletin. This value can either be an absolute URL in which case it fully overrides the Forum URL or it can be a relative URL, in which case it is appended to Forum URL.

For example, if vBulletin is located at http://example.com/vbulletin then entering a value of "blog" will result in the blog being located at http://example.com/vbulletin/blog. A value of "http://www.example.com/blog" will result in the blog being located at http://www.example.com/blog. All vBulletin URLs must have the same host name.

In addition to setting the Blog Component URL, you will need to take the following steps in order for the blog to work in the new location.

  1. If you are locating the blog in a directory other than a direct subdirectory of the vBulletin directory (http://example.com/vbulletin/blog in the above example), then edit blog/vb_dir.php in the do_not_upload directory of your download package to set the vBulletin install directory. Instructions are given in that file.
  2. Upload the blog files directory from the do_not_upload directory to the directory you want the blog to be located in. If you want the blog to be in http://example.com/vbulletin/myblog, create a subdirectory in your vBulletin directory called myblog and upload the blog files there.
  3. If you are using rewrite friendly URLs, you will need to copy the .htaccess file from do_not_upload/rewrite/apache2/blog to the stub directory before uploading.
  4. If you are using a different domain, such as blog.example.com versus www.example.com then you will need a crossdomain.xml file for the asset manager flash upload. Create a file called "crossdomain.xml" and place it in your blog subdirectory with the following contents modified to suit your domain.
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <cross-domain-policy xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.adobe.com/xml/schemas/PolicyFile.xsd"> <allow-access-from domain="*.example.com"/> <site-control permitted-cross-domain-policies="master-only"/> <allow-http-request-headers-from domain="*.example.com" headers="*" secure="true"/> </cross-domain-policy>

If the cookie path option is set for the site, it needs to be general enough to include all vBulletin URLs. For example, if vBulletin is located at www.host.com/mysite/vbulletin but the then is located at www.mysite.com/mysite/blog then a cookie path of "mysite" will work, but a cookie path of "mysite/vbulletin" will not work because the cookies will not be sent to pages in the mysite/then directory.
The list of allowed border width sizes for blog style customizations. Put each border width size on its own line.
The list of allowed fonts size for blog style customizations. Put each font size on its own line. You may use any size that is valid in CSS.
The list of allowed fonts for blog style customizations. Put each font on its own line.b
The list of allowed padding sizes for blog style customizations. Put each padding size on its own line.
Set this to the maximum number of videos you wish to allow per blog description. Set this to 0 to disable the videos count.
This setting controls permission for the soft deletion of blog entries.
This permission allows users to manage the comment that are left within their own blog. They will be able to moderate, edit, and soft delete these comments.
Can Manage Comments within Own Blog
This setting controls permission for the removal of blog entries, once removed the entry will no longer be available within the database.

If set to Yes this follows the moderation option defined within the blog options and the settings of the blog the comment is being posted to, if set to No the comments for this usergroup will always be moderated.
If set to Yes this follows the moderation option defined within the blog options, if set to No the entries for this usergroup will always be moderated.
This permission allows users to use bbcode in their blog entries.
This permission allows users to use HTML in their blog entries. This permission should be restricted to very secure users as it is a security risk.
This permission allows users to use [img] tags to display images inline in their blog entries.
This permission allows users to use smilies in their entries. Without this permission, smilies will remained unparsed.
This permission allows users to use [video] tags to display videos inline in their blog entries.
This permission allows users to post comments to other users' blogs.
Can Post Comments to Others' Blog
This permission allows users to post comments to their own entries.
Can Post Comments to Own Blog
This permission allows users to create their own blog categories. Without this permission, users will be limited to using admin created categories.
This permission allows users to create new tags. Users can only use existing tags if this permission is denied.
This permission allows users to delete their own comments. Comments on other users' entries will always be soft deleted.
This permission allows users to delete tags on their own blog entries. This includes their own tags and tags added by other users.
Can Delete Tags on Own Blog Entries
This permission allows users to edit their own blog entries.
This permission allows users to edit their own comments, on their own entries and other users' entries.

This permission allows members of this group to download / view entry attachments. If a user doesn't have this permission then inline attachments such as images will be displayed as links and clicking those and other attachment links will result in a "no permission" page.

This permission allows the owner to invite other members to join their blog. Members of the blog will be able to post entries under the owner's name. Member's must have the Can Join Group Blog permission before they can join other blogs.

This permission allows members to be invited to join other blogs. Joining a blog allows the member to post entries under the owner's name. Only members with the Can Have Group Blog permission can invite other members to join their blog.
This permission gives users the ability to create new blog entries.
This permission allows users to upload attachments to their blog entries.

This permission allows users to categorize their entries using admin defined categories. The way that you will want to utilize this permission is to grant this all usergroups, then use custom category permission to take it away from specific usergroups for specific categories.

Users will be able to receive pingback/trackback requests to their blog entries from other websites. This can fail for a number of reasons. Guests must be able to view the entries and the trackback/pingback server must be enabled in the admin options.
This permission allows the usergroup to search blog entries and comments.

Users will be able to send pingback/trackback requests from their blog entries to other websites. This can fail for a number of reasons. Guests must be able to view the entries and the trackback/pingback server must be enabled in the admin options.
This permission allows users to add tags to other users' blog entries.
This permission allows users to add tags to their own entries.

This permission allows users to view admin defined categories. The way that you will want to utilize this permission is to grant this all usergroups, then use custom category permission to take it away from specific usergroups for specific categories.
This permission allows users to view other users' blogs.
This permission allows the user to view their own blog, which is a requirement to be able to post entries.

phrasetype.name: FAQ Text
phrasetype.phrase: The Blog system gives you your own personal space at $vboptions[bbtitle]. Depending on how the administrator has configured the blog, you will be able to create your own entries and control who may view them.

Yes, you can customize the sidebar. With the customization you can rearrange the order of blocks and create your own custom blocks for additional content. To customize your sidebar click on "Blog Settings" in the navigation bar and then select "Organize Sidebar."
The blog sidebar contains the links to maintain your blog as well as information in regards to your blog and the other blogs that you may visit.

Wikipedia defines a blog as:
A blog is a type of website, usually maintained by an individual with regular entries of commentary, descriptions of events, or other material such as graphics or video. Entries are commonly displayed in reverse-chronological order. "Blog" can also be used as a verb, meaning to maintain or add content to a blog.

On this site, a blog is your own personal space to write about your topics and share them with other community members.
You must be invited by the blog owner in order to join a blog.
A Group Blog is a blog made up of entries from several contributors or authors. This is a good way to have a single blog with contributions from all of your staff.

You may categorize entries in multiple categories of your own creation. Before you may categorize entries, you must define your categories in the Blog Control Panel.

After creating your categories, you will be able to select multiple categories from the blog entry page during the creation of a new entry, or by editing an existing entry.

If you are allowed to post blog entries, you will always have a link at the top of the blog sidebar titled "Add new Post". This link allows you to post entries immediately, entries that will post automatically at a future date, or create a draft entry for later review and posting.

Draft entries allow you to compose an entry in stages. To create a draft entry, create an entry as normal but before submitting the entry, find Publish Status in the Miscellaneous Options on the lower section of the entry creation page. This option defaults to Publish Now.

Change Publish Now to Draft and then save. Alternatively, you may press the Save Draft button at any time.

Your Pending and Draft entries are only viewable by you until they are published.

You may also post entries that have a time stamp in the past. This is useful for those entries that you just forgot to post and they work best in chronological order.

To past date an entry, create an entry as normal but before submitting the entry, find Publish Status in the Miscellaneous Options on the lower section of the entry creation page. This option defaults to Publish Now.

Change Publish Now to Publish On and then choose the date and time that you wish for the entry to appear to have been posted. If you select a date in the future, you will be creating a Pending Entry.

Entries that you wish to create now but have them become publicly available at a later time are referred to as Pending Entries. To create a pending entry, create an entry as normal but before submitting the entry, find Publish Status in the Miscellaneous Options on the lower section of the entry creation page. This option defaults to Publish Now.

Change Publish Now to Publish On and then choose the date and time that you wish for the entry to go live. Due to the architecture, pending entries can appear a few minutes later than the time that you specify but they will have a time stamp that matches the date and time that you choose.

Your Pending and Draft entries are only viewable by you until they are published.

The Allow comments to be posted option controls the commenting ability of your viewers. When this option is disabled, only you and blog moderators will be able to comment on the entry. If you are allowed to edit entries, you may turn this option on and off after an entry has been published to control the commenting ability as time passed.

You may set the default for this choice in the Blog Control Panel.

The Moderate comments before posting option controls the visibility of comments. When this option is enabled, comments by anyone other than you and blog moderators are invisible until you approve them. If you are allowed to edit entries, you may turn this option on and off after an entry has been published to control the visibility of new comments as time passed.

You may set the default for this choice in the Blog Control Panel.

The Notify blogs linked within this blog entry and Send Trackback / Pingback to options allow you to notify other blogs that you have posted an entry in regard to them. You should always include the link to the other blog entry in your entry. Once you send the pingback request, the other blog is going to request your entry and verify that you really did include the link. If you are allowed to edit entries, you may still send pingback notices after the entry has been published.

This option will not appear if trackbacks / pingbacks have been disabled by the administrator.

The Allow trackback / pingback option controls the usability of trackbacks and pingbacks. When this option is enabled, other blogs may post trackback (or pingback) entries to your blog. Trackback and pingback entries are always moderated by default so they will not be seen by anyone else until you approve them. If you are allowed to edit entries, you may turn this option on and off after an entry has been published.

You may set the default for this choice in the Blog Control Panel.

This option will not appear if trackbacks / pingbacks have been disabled by the administrator.

The Restrict entry viewing to Contacts and Blog Moderators option will restrict the viewing of an entry to just those members on your contact list and to Blog moderators. This allows you to leave your blog open to all members but still have the ability to restrict viewing on an entry to entry basis.

phrasetype.phrase: You can choose to display blog entries of Blogs in specific categories.
This is the maximum number of blog entries that will display in the block.
This setting allows you to specify how many characters of the blog entry preview text to display in the block.
Length of Blog Entry Preview Text
This setting allows you to specify how many characters of the blog entry title to display in the block.

Choose which blog entry type do you want to display:
New Started - Newly published blog entries will display first
New Replied - Newly commented blog entries will displayed first
Most Replied - Blog entries with most comments will display first
Most Viewed - Blog entries with most views will display first
You can choose to display blog entries of specific Blogs. Please input blog User IDs here, seperated by comma. For example: 1,25,634

The vBulletin Blog 2.0.x attachment system is not compatible with this version. You need to run this update to bring your existing attachments into the new system
Edit Blog Category Permissions For Usergroup: {1} in Category {2}

It is suggested that the number of featured entries is kept to a reasonable number. There is no issue with creating many specific entries, but random and latest entries can be heavy on the system. Every condition that is added to the entry (usergroups, username, etc) increases the amount of resources that is required to retrieve an entry. These resources are utilized whenever the refresh period expires. Obviously, choosing to refresh an entry every 30 minutes uses less resources than refreshing every 1 minute.

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: The number of categories that can be associated with each blog entry.
The total number of blog categories a user can create.
The number of comments to show per page when viewing a blog entry.

The blog often needs to wrap long unbroken text strings at a lower value than vBulletin does for posts. If you want the blog to automatically insert spaces into long words to make them wrap after a certain number of characters, set the number of characters in the box above.

To disable word wrap, enter 0.
Number of Characters Before Wrapping Text

Blocks that contain more characters than the value specified here will be rejected with a message telling the user to shorten their block.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.

When a custom block entry is submitted or edited vBulletin will check the number of images and smilies in the text and reject it if the number is greater than the value specified here.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.

When a custom block entry is submitted or edited vBulletin will check the number of videos in the text and reject it if the number is greater than the value specified here.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.
Users may manipulate the sidebar content blocks by choosing to enable, disable and reposition them. Uncheck any blocks that you do not wish for users to be able to manipulate.

Enabling this option will add an icon to the display of forum posts that will allow the user to copy the content of the post to the content of a new blog entry. The user will be able to modify the entry and will still need to submit it.

Comments that contain more characters than the value specified here will be rejected with a message telling the user to shorten their comment.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.

When a comment is submitted or edited vBulletin will check the number of images and smilies in the text and reject it if the number is greater than the value specified here.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.

When a comment is submitted or edited vBulletin will check the number of videos in the text and reject it if the number is greater than the value specified here.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.
When enabled, all new comments are placed into moderation. This can also be enabled in usergroup permissions.
The blog options on the New User creation form in in the Admin Control Panel, as well as the blog options form will default to the following settings.

You can limit the number of draft entries that a user may posess.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.

Entries that contain more characters than the value specified here will be rejected with a message telling the user to shorten their entry.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.

When an entry is submitted or edited vBulletin will check the number of images and smilies in the text and reject it if the number is greater than the value specified here.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.

When an entry is submitted or edited vBulletin will check the number of videos in the text and reject it if the number is greater than the value specified here.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.
The maximum number of entries to display on a page before splitting it over multiple pages.
Maximum Displayed Entries Before Page Split
The maximum number of rated blogs that will appear on the blog intro page.
The maximum number of rated entries that will appear on the blog intro page.
The maximum number of recent comments that will appear on the blog intro page.
The maximum number of recent entries that will appear on the blog intro page.

The maximum total tags per entry. No users may add more tags than this to any entry

0 disables this.

The maximum number of tags that the entry author can apply. Even if this setting allows it, the number of tags in an entry cannot exceed the "Maximum Tags per Entry" setting.

0 disables this limit. To prevent a user from tagging an entry, use user group permissions.
Maximum Tags Applied by Entry Author

The maximum number of tags the users other than the entry author can apply. Even if this setting allows it, the number of tags in an entry cannot exceed the "Maximum Tags per Entry" setting.

0 disables this limit. To prevent a user from tagging an entry, use user group permissions.
Maximum Tags Applied by Other Users

Enable this option to have the Next and Previous entry titles (by date) shown next to the current entry's title when viewing an entry. This feature will add two queries to the page. By default only "Next" and "Prev" are displayed whether or not there may be an actual "Next" or "Prev" entry to view.
You may limit the number of link notifications that are sent with each entry. The user will be able to choose which links to notify at post time.

Custom pages that contain more characters than the value specified here will be rejected with a message telling the user to shorten their custom page.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.

When a custom page entry is submitted or edited vBulletin will check the number of images and smilies in the text and reject it if the number is greater than the value specified here.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.

When a custom page entry is submitted or edited vBulletin will check the number of videos in the text and reject it if the number is greater than the value specified here.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.

You can limit the number of entries that a user may have pending.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.
The default number of entries to display on a page before splitting it over multiple pages.
This option enables vBulletin Blog to receive pingback notices. Pingback notices can be spam heavy and may increase server bandwidth depending on the amount of pingbacks received.
When enabled, all new blog entries are placed into moderation. This can also be enabled in usergroup permissions.
The minimum number of votes that a blog entry must receive before its rating appears.
The minimum number of combined post votes that a blog must receive before its rating appears.
The posting date cutoff for Recent Comments on the blog intro page.
The posting date cutoff for Recent Entries on the blog intro page.
This is the default length of the blog entry snippets shown on the user's main blog page and featured blog.
The number of days that individual blog stats (entries, comments, visitors) are kept for each blog.
You may choose to override your forum's default style, or the user's chosen style with a specific style for the blog.

Amount of time in minutes before the tag cloud data cache is regenerated.

A value of 0 will generate the tag cloud on each view.

The tag cloud pulls together data from all entries in all blogs. Users may not be able to see all of the entries that make up the tag cloud results. With this option, you can force the tag cloud to be built using the viewing user's permissions.

It is recommended that no permission checking be performed. At the worst, this will expose tags of entries that a user can not access because they are either in a private category or the blog owner has denied them access to the blog.

The number of levels to be shown in the tag cloud.

By default, there are 5 levels named level1 to level5, with the font size growing from its smallest size at level 1 to its largest at level 5.

Increasing this value above 5 requires a template change.

This option controls whether a tag cloud relating to the frequency of tag searches is shown at the bottom of the advanced search.

A usage-based tag cloud is always shown here.

Amount of days that the system will keep a record of tag searches for use in the search tag cloud.

0 means to use all data available.
The maximum number of tags to display in the tag cloud.

The number of days worth of data that should be used to generate the usage-based tag cloud here.

Tags added more than this many days ago will not change the size of the link in the cloud.
If you enable this option, "A" through "Z" will be replaced with "a" through "z" in tag names. Other characters will not be changed.
Force Tags to be Lower Case
This is a global option to enable or disable the blog tagging system. You may choose which usergroups can apply tags to entries in the usergroup permissions section.
The maximum number of characters in a tag name. This can be between 0 and 100.
The minimum number of characters in a tag name. This can be between 1 and 100.
This option enables vBulletin Blog to receive trackback notices. Trackback notices are spam heavy and may increase server bandwidth depending on the amount of trackbacks received.

Optional URL for your Blog.

If this is specified it will override the Forum URL setting for Blog pages. You may specify an absolute URL or a URL relative to your Forum URL

Examples:
http://blog.example.com
http://www.example.com/blog
blog

The URL should not have a trailing slash or contain the special directories ../ or ./

Note: If you change the Blog URL you must upload the Blog stub directory. See help for further information.
The list of allowed border width sizes for profile style customizations. Put each border width size on its own line.
The list of allowed fonts size for profile style customizations. Put each font size on its own line. You may use any size that is valid in CSS.
The list of allowed fonts for profile style customizations. Put each font on its own line.
The list of allowed padding sizes for profile style customizations. Put each padding size on its own line.

Blog descriptions that contain more characters than the value specified here will be rejected with a message telling the user to shorten their description.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.

When a blog description is submitted or edited vBulletin will check the number of images and smilies in the text and reject it if the number is greater than the value specified here.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.

When a blog description is submitted or edited vBulletin will check the number of videos in the text and reject it if the number is greater than the value specified here.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.
